Nevi.Description: Commonly known as moles, these are benign growths of melanocytes.

Recommendations.Observation: Regular monitoring for any changes in size, shape, color, or texture.
Recommendations.Removal: If a mole is causing irritation or cosmetic concerns, it can be removed via excision or laser treatment.
Recommendations.Prevention: Avoid excessive sun exposure and use sunscreen with a high SPF to prevent new moles from forming.
Recommendations.Self-examination: Regularly check moles for any changes (ABCDE rule: Asymmetry, Border irregularity, Color variation, Diameter larger than 6mm, Evolving).

Melanoma.Description: A malignant tumor of melanocytes, potentially life-threatening if not detected early.

Recommendations.Surgical Excision: Immediate removal with a margin of normal tissue around the tumor.
Recommendations.Lymph Node Biopsy: To check if cancer has spread.
Recommendations.Immunotherapy: Use of drugs to stimulate the immune system to attack cancer cells.
Recommendations.Targeted Therapy: Medications that target specific genes or proteins involved in melanoma.
Recommendations.Radiation Therapy: Used in advanced cases to target specific areas.
Recommendations.Prevention: Regular skin checks, avoiding tanning beds, wearing protective clothing, and using broad-spectrum sunscreen.

normal.Description: No disease detected. Skin appears healthy.

Recommendations.Skin Care: Maintain regular skin hygiene and moisturizing.
Recommendations.Protection: Use sunscreen to prevent UV damage.
Recommendations.Healthy Lifestyle: Consume a balanced diet and stay hydrated to support skin health.

Benign Keratosis Like Lesions.Description: Includes seborrheic keratoses, solar lentigines, and lichen planus-like keratoses.

Recommendations.Observation: Often requires no treatment unless symptomatic or for cosmetic reasons.
Recommendations.Cryotherapy: Freezing the lesion with liquid nitrogen.
Recommendations.Curettage: Scraping the lesion off the skin.
Recommendations.Laser Therapy: Using laser to remove the lesion.
Recommendations.Topical Treatments: Such as alpha-hydroxy acids or retinoids for milder cases.
Recommendations.Prevention: Use of sunscreen to protect against sun damage, regular skin moisturizing.

Basal Cell Carcinoma.Description: The most common type of skin cancer, arising from basal cells.

Recommendations.Mohs Surgery: A precise surgical technique that removes cancerous cells layer by layer.
Recommendations.Topical Treatments: Such as imiquimod or 5-fluorouracil for superficial BCC.
Recommendations.Radiation Therapy: For cases where surgery is not an option.
Recommendations.Prevention: Regular skin checks, avoiding excessive sun exposure, using sunscreen, wearing protective clothing.

Actinic Keratoses.Description: Precancerous lesions caused by sun damage, can develop into squamous cell carcinoma.

Recommendations.Cryotherapy: Freezing the lesion with liquid nitrogen.
Recommendations.Topical Treatments: Such as 5-fluorouracil, imiquimod, or diclofenac gel.
Recommendations.Photodynamic Therapy: Using light-activated drugs to destroy abnormal cells.
Recommendations.Prevention: Regular skin checks, wearing sun-protective clothing, using broad-spectrum sunscreen, avoiding peak sun hours.

Vascular Lesions.Description: Includes cherry angiomas, hemangiomas, and pyogenic granulomas.

Recommendations.Observation: Many vascular lesions do not require treatment.
Recommendations.Laser Therapy: Using laser to remove or reduce the size of the lesion.
Recommendations.Electrosurgery: Burning the lesion off with electrical current.
Recommendations.Prevention: Generally, no specific preventive measures; maintaining healthy skin through good skincare practices.

Dermatofibroma.Description: A common benign fibrous nodule, usually resulting from a minor injury.

Recommendations.Observation: Often does not require treatment unless symptomatic.
Recommendations.Surgical Excision: Removal if the lesion is painful or bothersome.
Recommendations.Prevention: No specific preventive measures; maintaining healthy skin.
